text: Earl Ethan Bakken (January 10, 1924 - October 21, 2018) was an American engineer, businessman and philanthropist. He founded Medtronic, where he developed the first external, battery-operated, transistorized, wearable artificial pacemaker in 1957.Hebrew University of Jerusalem Institute of Chemistry: Earl E. Bakken Bakken retired from Medtronic in 1989 and moved to a 9-acre estate in the Kona District of Hawaii he calls Bakken Hale. Bakken died at his Hawaii home on October 21, 2018 at the age of 94.Medtronic founder Earl Bakken Has Died at His Home In Hawaii ==References== ==Other websites== * Earl Bakken's Website * The Bakken Museum Homepage Category:1924 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Philanthropists from Minnesota Category:Businesspeople from Minnesota Category:Scientists from Minnesota Category:American electronic engineers
title: Earl Bakken
